resources.string: En token giver andre personer tilladelse til at bruge din konto.
Vælg omhyggeligt, hvad den har lov til at gøre på dine vegne.
Så du kan huske, hvad denne token er beregnet til
Hvad token kan gøre på dine vegne:
Denne token vil give adgang til din konto. Del den IKKE med nogen!
Sørg for at kopiere din nye, personlige adgangstoken nu. Du vil ikke kunne få den vist igen!

string.name: preferenceRead
string.comment:
In the context of an authentication token, this is a setting that gives a third-party app permission to view the user's preferences.
There is a separate setting to let applications write (edit) preferences.

string.name: preferenceWrite
string.comment:
In the context of an authentication token, this is a setting that gives a third-party app permission to edit/change the user's preferences.
There is a separate setting to let applications only read preferences, but not to write (edit) them.

string.name: emailRead
string.comment: In the context of an authentication token, this is a setting that gives a third-party app permission to view the user's registered email address.

string.name: challengeRead
string.comment:
In the context of an authentication token, this is a setting that gives a third-party app permission to view game challenges from other players.
There is a separate setting to let applications send, accept or reject challenges.

string.name: challengeWrite
string.comment:
challengeWrite
In the context of an authentication token, a setting that permits third party software to send, accept and reject challenges on behalf of the player.

resources.string: Opret mange partier på én gang for andre spillere

string.name: studyRead
string.comment: Gives permission to third-party software to *read* information that already exists. However it won't be able to write (create) private studies or broadcasts.

string.name: studyWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting that enables third party software to create, update or delete studies and broadcasts.

resources.string: Opret, opdater, slet studier og udsendelser

string.name: tournamentWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting that permits third party software to create, update or delete studies and join tournaments.

resources.string: Opret, opdater og deltag i turneringer

string.name: racerWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third party software to create, and join puzzle races (this is for the activity/minigame Puzzle Racer: https://lichess.org/racer)

string.name: puzzleRead
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to view the user's puzzle solving history.

string.name: teamRead
string.comment: Gives permission to third-party software to *read* information that already exists. However it won't be able to write (create) private studies or broadcasts.

string.name: teamWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting that permits the third party software to join or leave teams on your behalf.

resources.string: Administrer hold du leder: send PM\'er, smid medlemmer af holdet

string.name: followRead
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to view (read) which players you are following.

string.name: followWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to follow and unfollow other players on your behalf.

string.name: msgWrite
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to send messages on your behalf.

resources.string: Send privat besked til andre spillere

string.name: boardPlay
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to play games using e-boards like DGT, through Lichess's board API.

string.name: botPlay
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to play games over the bot API. This is intended mainly for having an engine account e.g. the accounts featured on https://lichess.org/player/bots

resources.string: Se og brug dit eksterne skakprogram

string.name: webLogin
string.comment: In the context of an access token, a setting which permits third-party software to create authenticated sessions - meaning effectively unlimited access to your account, using it as if it is you, instead of a third party program. It will be unable to view your password but it will be able to do almost everything else.

string.name: webMod
string.comment: In the context of an access token, this is a setting which permits third-party software to use moderator tools on your behalf. Most players will not be able to see this option.

resources.string: Brug moderatorværktøjer (inden for rammerne af din tilladelse)

string.name: canMakeOauthRequests
string.comment: %s is 'authorisation code flow' (flow, as in a process).

resources.string: Du kan lave OAuth-anmodninger uden at gå gennem %s.

string.name: authorizationCodeFlow
string.comment:
Part of longer string canMakeOauthRequests: You can make OAuth requests without going through the authorisation code flow.
In this context, 'flow' means a process.
This text is also a link which directs to https://lichess.org/api#section/Introduction/Authentication.

string.name: insteadGenerateToken
string.comment: %s is 'generate a personal access token'.

resources.string: %s, som du i stedet kan bruge direkte i API-anmodninger.

string.name: generatePersonalToken
string.comment:
Part of longer string insteadGenerateToken: 'Instead, generate a personal access token you can directly use in API requests.'
It is a link, which links to https://lichess.org/account/oauth/token/create and appears after you have created at least one token.

resources.string: Pas godt på disse tokens! De svarer til adgangskoder. Fordelen ved at bruge tokens frem for at skrive din adgangskode i et script er, at tokens kan tilbagekaldes, og du kan generere mange af dem.

string.name: apiDocumentationLinks
string.comment:
%1$s links to a personal token app example (string: personalTokenAppExample).
%2$s links to the API documentation (string: apiDocumentation).
These can both be translated separately.

string.name: personalTokenAppExample
string.comment:
Part of longer string apiDocumentationLinks: 'Here's a personal token app example and the API documentation.'
This text is also a link which directs to https://github.com/lichess-org/api/tree/master/example/oauth-personal-token.

string.name: apiDocumentation
string.comment:
Part of longer string apiDocumentationLinks: 'Here's a personal token app example and the API documentation.'
This text is also a link which directs to https://lichess.org/api.

string.name: created
string.comment: %s is relative time, e.g. 2 hours ago.

string.name: lastUsed
string.comment: %s is relative time, e.g. 2 hours ago. 'Last used' in this context means 'You used this most recently %s time ago'.

resources.string: Det er muligt at forhåndsudfylde denne formular ved at tilpasse forespørgselsparametrene i URL\'en.

string.name: forExample
string.comment:
%s is an example URL.
Please note the sentence continues on the next line. The complete sentence is: 'For example: https://lichess.org/account/oauth/token/create?scopes[]=challenge:write&scopes[]=puzzle:read&description=Prefilled+token+example ticks the challenge:create and puzzle:read scopes, and sets the token description.'

string.name: ticksTheScopes
string.comment:
Part of a longer sentence, this is the second line:
'For example: https://lichess.org/account/oauth/token/create?scopes[]=challenge:write&scopes[]=puzzle:read&description=Prefilled+token+example ticks the challenge:create and puzzle:read scopes, and sets the token description.'
%1$s is 'challenge:create', %2$s is 'puzzle:read' which are both used as technical examples. These should not be translated which is why they are included as substituted strings.

resources.string: markerer %1$s og %2$s omfang og indstiller token-beskrivelsen.

string.name: scopesCanBeFound
string.comment:
scopesCanBeFound
For this page in particular, developers can link to it so that some options are pre-ticked when a user follows the URL.
To pre-tick those options, developers need the scope codes, which they can find by inspecting the source code of the page itself.

resources.string: Omfangskoderne kan findes i HTML-koden for formularen.
Hvis du giver disse forudfyldte URL\'er til dine brugere, hjælper det dem med at få de rigtige token-omfang.
